toc_entry.title: A Peach Of a Deal
toc_entry.description: Texas is cattle, oil, Stetsons, peaches, branding irons . . . peaches?

toc_entry.title: Trouble In Paradise
toc_entry.description: Resort hotels and luxury condominiums line the shore of South Padre, yet foot by foot, day by day, the island is washing away.

toc_entry.title: Barton Springs Eternal
toc_entry.description: What was once a mere rural spring is now a crowded, languorous, bare-skinned utopia.

toc_entry.title: The Death Of a Ranger
toc_entry.description: Bob Doherty was a Texas Ranger who believed in the myth of the Old West; Greg Ott was a college dope dealer, a child of the sixties. When they met, it destroyed both their lives.

toc_entry.title: Labor Pains
toc_entry.description: Second-generation refinery workers don’t believe in politicians or corporations and some of them don’t believe in unions. The question is, do they believe in strikes?

toc_entry.title: The Loser
toc_entry.subtitle: Country Notes
toc_entry.description: When another farmer goes broke, his neighbors thank God it wasn’t them; then they wonder when their turn is coming.

toc_entry.title: Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: If you’re going bald, there’s only one thing to do: blame mother.

toc_entry.title: The Missing Link
toc_entry.subtitle: Dining In
toc_entry.description: How to stuff a wild salami.

toc_entry.title: Grand Unction
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: Grease is about as appealing as its name implies.

toc_entry.title: In Praise Of Follies
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: A motley crew of actors, writers, and musicians are creating the most talked-about theater in austin.

toc_entry.title: The Hills Are Alive
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Once a year in Fayette County sauerkraut and sausage give way to classical music.

toc_entry.title: Notes From the Ground
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Most pop festivals have moved into stadiums, but this summer two Texas musical events blossomed in the great outdoors.

toc_entry.title: The Shape Of Things To Come
toc_entry.subtitle: architecture
toc_entry.description: The future’s over, and the past has just begun.

toc_entry.title: Apple Encore
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Max apple’s oddball touches make a zany and endearing novel.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Stalking elusive birds and energy czars.

toc_entry.title: The Inside Story
toc_entry.description: The truth, the whole truth.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: In the name of Justice.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: My kingdom for a horse.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Monthly Reporter
toc_entry.description: Plainview puts a lid on deviate sex; billions of animals sleep in a freezer; oil spills are coming and we’re not ready.

toc_entry.title: Contest
toc_entry.description: Not the same old cliché.
